title: Ticket #4910: Restore gnu linker option to wrap exit()
description:
For unix, we define our own exit() function that can either call _exit() or exec() a program when the current process wants to exit. This is important for daemons in certain situations. We used to use a feature of the gnu linker to have our exit() alternative replace exit() for all callsites, and allow it to call the real exit() when appropriate.

We lost the use of this gnu linker option when the build system was switched to cmake. As a consequence, we always terminate daemons and tools with a call to _exit() on unix, which bypasses exit-time cleanup code like global destructors. This can confuse run-time code analysis tools, leave FILE buffers unwritten, and bypass other cleanup code.
